docs.title: <attack> What Is This?
docs.text:
Prosty zbiór kart zawartych w grze Heroes of Might and Magic 3: The Board Game, który zawiera również dodatkowe wyjaśnienia dotyczące działania niektórych kart oraz ich wzajemnych interakcji.

Co jakiś czas chciałem sprawdzić, co robią niektóre karty - czy to podczas obmyślania strategii, czy nawet w trakcie gry, gdy chcę coś wyjaśnić albo znaleźć odniesienie. Ta baza danych ma na celu zapewnienie łatwego dostępu do dowolnej karty w grze, a także wizualnego odniesienia i dodatkowych informacji tam, gdzie jest to konieczne (lub możliwe).

docs.title: <defense> Future Plans?
docs.text:
• Dodać wyjaśnienia do wszystkich kart, które mogą ich potrzebować
  • Naprawić nieścisłości (wszystkie karty jak i ich tłumaczenia zostały wprowadzone ręcznie, istnieje ryzyko, że niektóre mogą zawierać literówki lub inne błędy)

docs.title: <power> Disclaimer
docs.text: To fanowski projekt i w żaden sposób nie jest powiązany z Archon Studio.

docs.title: <skill> Other Community Projects
docs.text: Oto kilka projektów społeczności homm3bg, które zdecydowanie warto zobaczyć.

docs.title: Magia Powietrza
docs.text:
RegularEmpowered

Ability

Type Effect <expert> Effect Regular <permanent> +1 <power> for spells from School of Air Magic. When casting <spell> from the School of Air, you can discard this card, then gain +3 <power>. Empowered <permanent> +1 <power> for spells from School of Air Magic.— OR — <instant> When casting <spell> from the School of Air, you can discard this card, then gain +3 <power>. -

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• The expert effect may be played either from hand, or from the field. This does, however, not add the two effects, and the ability is put into the discard pile after being played.
  • See Permanent Effect

docs.title: Łucznictwo
docs.text:
RegularEmpowered

Ability

Type Effect <expert> Effect Regular <ongoing> During this Combat round, your Ranged units gain +1 <attack> if the target is a non-adjacent unit. <ongoing> Until the end of the next Combat round, your Ranged units gain +1 <initiative> and +1 <attack> if the target is a non-adjacent unit. Empowered <ongoing> Until the end of the next Combat round, all of your Ranged units gain +1 <initiative> and +1 <attack> if the target is a non-adjacent unit. -

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text: • This ability is active during each ranged attack of the Combat round, which means that it applies to both attacks of Elves and Marksmen.

Ability

docs.title: Uwagi

docs.title: Artyleria
docs.text:
RegularEmpowered

Ability

Type Effect <expert> Effect Regular <instant> Deal 1 <damage> to an enemy unit with the lowest <initiative>. <instant> When using the Ballista card, resolve its effect against the same target 3 times. Empowered <instant> When using the Ballista card, resolve its effect against the same target 3 times. -

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• If multiple enemy units share the same (lowest) initiative, the player can choose which of those units should this ability deal damage to.
  • The expert effect can only be played when the Ballista activates, which can only happen at the beginning of each Combat round.
  • Without an active Ballista, only the basic effect of this ability can be resolved.
  • In combination with Astrologers proclaim week of the Ammo Cart the expert effect will deal 3 times 2 damage, so 6 damage in total.

docs.title: Dyplomacja
docs.text:
RegularEmpowered

Ability

Type Effect <expert> Effect Regular <map_effect> For every Dwelling you have, draw 1 corresponding Neutral Unit card. You can Recruit one of these units if you <pay> its Recruitment cost. <instant> Skip Combat with Neutral Units on a field whose Field Difficulty is equal to your Hero's level. Visit the field. This Hero gains no Experience. Empowered <map_effect> For every Dwelling you have, draw 1 corresponding Neutral Unit card. You can Recruit one of these units if you <pay> its Recruitment cost.— OR — <instant> Skip Combat with any Neutral Units on the same level as your Hero. Claim the given field and resolve its effect. This Hero gains no Experience. -

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• If the player already has a <golden> dwelling, they draw cards from both, the <golden> and <azure> Neutral decks.
  • The recruitment costs for neutral units can be found on the card of the respective unit.
  • For recruitment that happens as a result of using this ability, the recruitment token shall not be flipped. This means this ability may be used even after the player has already recruited units during this round.
  • 1 When played with miniatures (e.g. such as when playing on the large battlefield), this ability cannot be used to recruit units from a faction controller by another player, nor to recruit neutral units that are already recruited by another player. Should a player draw such card, that may not be recruited, they shall draw a replacement card instead.

docs.text:
RegularEmpowered

Ability

Type Effect <expert> Effect Regular <instant> Remove 1 <damage> from one of your units. <instant> When using the First Aid Tent card, resolve its effect against the same target 3 times. Empowered <instant> When using the First Aid Tent card, resolve its effect against the same target 3 times. -

docs.title: Inteligencja
docs.text:
RegularEmpowered

Ability

Type Effect <expert> Effect Regular <instant> During Combat, before any unit activates, play a Spell card. You can still only play a Spell card during a Combat round. <instant> During Combat, before any unit activates, play a Spell card. This spell does not count toward your spell limit per Combat round. Empowered <instant> At the beginning of the Combat round, play a Spell card.This spell does not count toward your Spell limit per Combat round. -

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• If both players are resolving cards with effects at the start of the Combat (e.g. playing Intelligence), the attacker (or the player with the initiative token) may resolve their card first.
  • This ability can only be played at the start of the Combat itself, not at the start of any Combat round.

docs.text:
RegularEmpowered

Ability

Type Effect <expert> Effect Regular <instant> Play when the Hero is about to level up. Advance their Experience Level by an additional half level. <instant> Play when the Hero is about to level up. Advance their Experience Level by an additional level, then Remove this card. Empowered <instant> Play when the Hero is about to level up. Advance their Experience Level by an additional half level.— OR — <instant> Play when the Hero is about to level up. Advance their Experience Level by an additional level, then Remove this card. -

docs.title: Logistyka
docs.text:
RegularEmpowered

Ability

Type Effect <expert> Effect Regular <ongoing> At the end of your turn, move your Hero's model to an adjacent empty field. <instant> Your Hero gains +1 Movement. Empowered <instant> Your Hero gains +1 <movement>. -

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• Fields are considered empty if they can not provide an effect or no longer provide an effect. This means that fields with black cubes or the player's faction cubes count as empty.
  • The additional Movement point may also be granted to the secondary hero.
  • The additional Movement point is single use effect, it does not permanently increase the maximum movement points of a hero.

docs.title: Szczęście
docs.text:
RegularEmpowered

Ability

Type Effect <expert> Effect Regular <ongoing> You can reroll a Treasure die and a Resource die once during this turn. <ongoing> You can reroll any die once during this turn. Empowered <ongoing> You can reroll any die once during this turn. -

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• The expert effect allows to reroll every die that the player rolls during their entire turn. This includes every attack die during all of the fights during their turn.
  • This ability may be played during an enemy's turn, only in a fight, and only if the player hero is defending themselves. It can only be played during the activation of a friendly unit.

docs.title: Mistycyzm
docs.text:
RegularEmpowered

Ability

Type Effect <expert> Effect Regular <instant> Play this card immediately after casting a spell. Instead of discarding the Spell card, take it back into your hand. <instant> Play this card immediately after casting a spell. Instead of discarding the Spell card and all other cards played together with it, take them back to your hand. Empowered <instant> Play this card immediately after casting a spell. Instead of discarding the Spell card and all other cards played together with it, take them back to your hand. -

docs.title: Nekromancja
docs.text:
RegularEmpowered

Ability

Type Effect <expert> Effect Regular <map_effect> Play after winning Combat other than Quick Combat. You can Reinforce a <bronze> or <silver> unit of your choice for half the <gold> cost (rounded down). <map_effect> Play after winning Combat other than Quick Combat. You can Reinforce any unit of your choice for half the <gold> cost (rounded down). Empowered <map_effect> Play after winning Combat other than Quick Combat. You can Reinforce any unit of your choice for half the <gold> cost (rounded down). -

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• Only the heroes belonging to the Necropolis Faction may play Necromancy.
  • Necromancy may only be used to reinforce units that belong to the Necropolis Faction.
  • The reinforcing of units via Necromancy can also take place when the player does not have the Citadel built in their town.
  • If a hero that does not belong to the Necropolis Faction should draw it from the Ability deck, they may put it into the discard pile and draw another card instead. They may also choose to keep the card, they may, however, not play it.

docs.title: Odporność
docs.text:
RegularEmpowered

Ability

Type Effect <expert> Effect Regular <instant> Play this card immediately after the enemy casts a spell. If the spell was cast with 1 <power> or less, ignore the Spell card's effect. <instant> Play this card immediately after the enemy casts a spell. Ignore the Spell card's effect. Empowered <instant> Play this card immediately after the enemy casts a spell. Ignore the Spell card's effect. -

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• The player's primary hero must take part in the Combat. It is not possible to play Resistance if the enemy hero is in Combat with neutral units or another player.

docs.title: Adventure
docs.text: Adventure is a Battlefield-only game mode that comes with the Battlefield Expansion.

docs.title: Karty
docs.text: Adventure mode includes Adventure cards of two types, Combat and Event.

docs.title: Adventure-Event Card
docs.text:
To resolve an Adventure Event card, resolve its effect.

Name Effect Campfire Roll 1 Attack die. On a "+1" result, roll 2 <resource_die> and resolve 1 of them.Otherwise, roll 1 <resource_die> and resolve it. Corpse Search (2) the <artifact> deck. Learning Stone If your Hero is below level 4, gain 2 <experience>.Otherwise, gain 1 <experience>. docs.title: Adventure-Combat Card
docs.text:
Each card contains the Battle Reward and the Basic Reward, with the Battle Reward scaling based on which Combat Power (the number in the circle) the player chooses to challenge.

To resolve an Adventure Combat card, do the following:

  • Choose one of the available Combat Powers (the number in the circle) from the card
  • Select 2 of your units, add their <attack> values and roll 2 Attack dice

If your total power is equal or greater than the chosen Combat Power:

  • Take the Battle Reward corresponding to that Combat Power
  • Take the Basic Reward

If your total power is lower than the chosen Combat Power:

  • Take the Basic Reward
  • Put a <paralysis> token on one of your units that took part in this Combat

To get rid of the <paralysis> token, choose the unit for Combat - do not add its <attack> to your power, then remove the <paralysis> token.

Gain 1 <artifact>.10 ➣ Roll and resolve 2 <resource_die>. Gain 1 <artifact>.12 ➣ Roll and resolve 2 <resource_die>. docs.title: Walka
docs.text: AI Combat rules are the same, regardless of fighting against Neutral or Enemy AI units.

docs.title: Initiative
docs.text:
Just like non-AI combat, the unit with the highest <initiative> goes first. In case of a tie, the attacking Hero has priority. If both sides have units with the same initiative, they activate in an alternating fashion, so first the attacker, then the defender.

When fighting an AI Hero, every time one of their units activates, draw a card from their AI and resolve the effect in their stead. The strength of the effect depends on the game difficulty.

docs.title: Targeting
docs.text:
The targeting priorities below assume that conditions are checked from the top and the first matching target is then selected.

docs.title: Movement
docs.text:
AI Heroes have 3 MP ( <movement>), which they spend to perform the following actions in descending priority:

  • If a player's Hero is on the same Tile as the AI, spend all MP to move towards them and attempt to start Combat.
  • If there are any Mines or Settlements that can be flagged, move towards the closest one.
  • Move towards the player's Town.

docs.title: Szarfa Ambasadora
docs.text:
Major Artifact

<map_effect> For every Dwelling you have, draw 1 corresponding Neutral Unit card. You can Recruit one of these units.— OR — <instant> Reroll a die.

You pause to help a diplomat with a broken axle to fix his problem. In gratitude, he gives you a sash with magical properties which he says will, "help people see things your way."

docs.title: Skrzydła Anioła
docs.text:
Relic Artifact

<map_effect> Chosen Hero gains +1 <movement> and can move through any fields without resolving them. The last visited field must be resolved normally.— OR — <instant> Draw a card.

Not really wanting to know where the Angel, whose wings these belong to, is, you take the wings and quickly depart.

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• After playing Angel Wings, the hero may move through borders and blocked fields. They may, however, not end their movement on a blocked field.
  • See Blocked Field

<instant> Draw 1 card and gain +1 <attack>.— OR — <instant> Draw 1 card and gain +1 <defense>.

A gang of Rogues is sifting through the possessions of some dead warriors. Scaring off the scavengers, you notice the Rogues had overlooked a dirty, but serviceable, breastplate.

docs.title: Ramiona Legionu
docs.text:
Major Artifact

<instant> Reduce the Recruitment or Reinforcement cost of a unit by 5 <gold> - to a minimum of 0.— OR — <instant> Gain 2 <building_materials>.

Searching a ruin, you are amazed to find a piece of the Statue of Legion. You carefully dust it off before placing it in your pack.

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• This artifact only reduces the recruitment cost, it does not allow for an additional recruitment to take place. During a round in which the player already recruited units (their population marker is already turned over), the discount effect provides no benefit, as the player may no longer recruit.
  • The recruitment discount may be played in combination with cards that allow recruitment (e.g. Necromancy).
  • Should the player recruit outside of their turn, the effect of the Arms of Legion may not be used.

<instant> Reduce the Recruitment or Reinforcement cost of a unit by 5 <gold> - to a minimum of 0.— OR — <instant> Gain 2 <gold>.

Searching a ruin, you are amazed to find a piece of the Statue of Legion. You carefully dust it off before placing it in your pack.

docs.title: Tajemnicza Sfera Many
docs.text:
Major Artifact

<instant> Search(../4) your discard pile.— OR — <instant> Only if your discard pile is empty. Draw 2 cards.

You come upon a caravan of gypsies who are feasting and fortifying their bodies with mead. They call you forward and say, "If you prove that you can dance the Rama-Buta, we will reward you." You don't know it, but try anyway. They laugh hysterically, but admire your bravery, giving you a strange orb.

docs.title: Naszyjnik Smoczych Zębów
docs.text:
Major Artifact

<instant> +2 <power>.— OR — <ongoing> During this Combat, you can cast 2 <spell> per Combat round.

An old shaman stands in the road before you, screaming something in a language you can't understand. He suddenly vanishes in a cloud of smoke. When the smoke clears, there is a long string of Dragon teeth in the spot where he was standing.

docs.text:
Minor Artifact

<ongoing> During this Combat, the <initiative> of all your <unit_ground> units is increased by 1.— OR — <activation> Move one of your units 1 space.

Visiting a local wise man, you explain the intent of your journey. He reaches into a sack and withdraws a strange necklace which he hands to you.

docs.title: Niszczycielska Maczuga Ogrów
docs.text:
Major Artifact

<instant> Discard 1 card to gain +2 <attack>.— OR — <instant> +1 <attack>

At a roadside tavern, a drunken Ogre challenges you to a fight. Not wanting to hurt the creature, you subdue him, instead. You take his massive club from him to prevent him from getting into any more trouble.

docs.title: Orb of Driving Rain
docs.text:
Major Artifact

<ongoing> When casting a <spell> from the School of Water Magic, double the <power> used for this spell.— OR — <instant> When casting a Water Magic <spell>, Remove this card to gain +5 <power>.

You come across a conjurer who begs to accompany you and your army awhile for safety. You agree, and he offers as payment a strange orb of the elements.

<ongoing> During this Combat, all <spell> and Specialty cards deal 0 <damage>. Remove this card instead of discarding it.— OR — <ongoing> During this Combat round, units cannot use their special abilities.

You help a Peasant catch a mare. As gratitude, he hands you a sphere. When you grasp it, you feel the magical energy drain from your limbs...

docs.text:
Relic Artifact

<ongoing> During this Combat, negate all units' special abilities related to <spell>.— OR — <instant> +2 <power>

You meet an old Wizard fiend of yours traveling in the opposite direction. He presents you with a gift: An orb that allows nearby magic resistant creatures to be harmed by magic.

docs.title: Wisiorek Odwagi
docs.text:
Major Artifact

<instant> Play this card immediately after you perform a Search action and perform that action again.— OR — <instant> Gain 1 <expert>.

Responding to cries for help, you find river Sprites making a sport of dunking an old man. You rescue him and drag the Sprites onto dry land. The Sprites, uncomfortable in the air, give you a magic pendant to let them go.

docs.title: Wisiorek Negatywności
docs.text:
Major Artifact

<instant> Ignore the effect of a spell from the School of Air Magic— OR — <ongoing> Ignore the effect of a spell from the School of Air Magic cast on this unit.

You come upon the remains of a small hut which was clearly destroyed by a very large bolt of lightning. Sifting through the debris, you find an undamaged pendant that seems to tingle in your hand.

docs.title: Wisiorek Magicznej Wizji
docs.text:
Major Artifact

<ongoing> Selected unit cannot gain <paralysis> during this Combat.— OR — <instant> Remove 1 <paralysis> token.

You come upon a very old woman dying alone. You tend to her final needs and promise a proper burial. Grateful, she gives you a magic pendant emblazoned with a stylized eye. It lets you see with your eyes closed.

docs.title: Plate of the Dying Light
docs.text:
Relic Artifact

<instant> +1 <defense>. This effect can be used to reduce <damage> from <spell>.— OR — <instant> +4 <defense>. This effect can be used to reduce <damage> from <spell>. Then Remove this card.

A brazen goblin with a luxurious armor on his chest questions your power. With a powerful kick in the ass, you prove him wrong.

docs.title: Quiet Eye of the Dragon
docs.text:
Minor Artifact

<ongoing> For this Combat, your selected unit gains +1 <attack>.— OR — <instant> +1 <defense>

While venturing into a decrepit hut you find the skeleton of a long dead witch. Investigation of the remains reveals a ring with a Dragon's eye set into it.

Major Artifact

<ongoing> During this Combat, no Hero can use spells with Power "0".— OR — <ongoing> During this Combat, no Hero can use Spells. Remove this card after Combat.

You discover a young woman fleeing from a hungry bear. You slay the beast in the nick of time, and the grateful Sorceress weaves a magic cloak from the bear's hide.

docs.title: Ognisty Język Czerwonego Smoka
docs.text:
Minor Artifact

<instant> +1 <defense>— OR — <instant> +1 <attack>

As you are walking along a narrow path, a nearby bush suddenly bursts into flames. Before your very eyes, the flames become the image of a beautiful woman. She holds out a magnificent sword to you.

Visiting a local wise man, you explain the intent of your journey. He reaches into a sack and withdraws a strange ring which he hands to you.

docs.title: Royal Armor of Nix
docs.text:
Major Artifact

<instant> +2 <power>— OR — <map_effect> If this Hero is on a Sea tile, Search(2) <spell>**.

You see a fight on a hill nearby. As you get closer, you see two nix. One is winning, and as he is about to land a finishing blow, you intervene. The defeated nix thanks you for your help, and gifts you with his armor. He believes you deserve it more than he does.

docs.title: Sandals of the Saint
docs.text:
Relic Artifact

<instant> Discard X cards from hand to gain +X <power>.— OR — <instant> Remove this card, then gain +4 <power>.

A Nomad trader seeks protection from a tribe of Goblins. For your assistance, he gives you a finely crafted pair of sandals made from the softest leather. Looking closely, you see fascinating ancient carvings engraved on the leather.

docs.text:
Minor Artifact

<instant> +3 <spell>— OR — <instant> +1 <spell>, then draw a card.

You meet an old Armorer, who claims he owes you a favor. Taking him up on it, he pieces together some Basilisk scales, forming a well-fashioned breastplate.

docs.title: Tarcza Strażnika Niebios
docs.text:
Relic Artifact

<instant> Discard 1 card to gain +3 <defense>.— OR — <instant> +2 <defense>

You find a large box that seems to be made from some unknown material. When you touch it, the box opens with a load hiss, revealing a gleaming shield within.

docs.title: Kajdany Wojny
docs.text:
Major Artifact

<instant> If played at the start of Combat, the Enemy Hero can neither Retreat nor Surrender.— OR — <instant> Draw 2 cards, choose 1 card and discard the other.

Walking through the ruins of an ancient walled city, you find the instrument of the city's destruction, the elaborately crafted Shackles of War.

docs.title: Shaman's Puppet
docs.text:
Minor Artifact

<ongoing> Choose a unit. Until the end of its activation, for its every attack, the unit rolls 2 dice and resolves the lower result.— OR — <instant> Remove any effect or <paralysis> from the selected unit.

You walked under the ladder and stepped on a black cat. Bad luck follows you, just as that ragged guy. You order to seize him, but he vanishes, leaving a strange doll behind.

docs.title: Shield of Naval Glory
docs.text:
Major Artifact

<instant> +2 <defense>— OR — <map_effect> If this Hero is on a Sea tile, they gain +1 <movement>, and draw 1 card.

You meet an old admiral at the tavern. After a couple of hours full of tales about glorious battles and days long passed he gifts you his parade shield.

docs.title: Tarcza Przeklętego
docs.text:
Major Artifact

<instant> Target unit gains +3 <defense> and suffers 1 <damage>. It cannot be used on an enemy unit.— OR — <instant> Target unit gains +5 <defense> and suffers 2 <damage>. It cannot be used on an enemy unit.

A Sprite is carrying a Shield as big as it is. Yuu ask, "Need help?" The Sprite glares at you and answers, "You think this is funny? Fine. You can carry it. I much prefer flying anyway."

docs.title: Tarcza Krasnoludzkich Władców
docs.text:
Minor Artifact

<instant> Use this after the Attack die roll. Ignore the Attack die and any additional effects it triggered.— OR — <instant> +1 <defense>

While searching through the rubble of a collapsed mine, you free a group of trapped Dwarves. Grateful, the leader ives you a finely crafted shield.

docs.title: Tarcza Zionącej Śmierci
docs.text:
Minor Artifact

<instant> Discard 1 card to gain +2 <defense>.— OR — <instant> +1 <defense>

Your units discover an eerie shrine dedicated to the Undead. You bless the shrine, causing the stone shield emblem, above the altar, to crack. Beneath it, is a real shield, which you decide to remove from this unholy place.

Minor Artifact

<instant> Discover any Map tile adjacent to the Map tile your Hero is currently on..— OR — <instant> Remove this card, then draw 1 card.

A merchant from far away lands, trades you a new invention of his people for traveling supplies. It makes distant objects appear closer, and he calls it, a Speculum.

docs.title: Kapelusz Czarodzieja
docs.text:
Relic Artifact

<instant> Remove 1 card from your hand, then Search(2) the card's deck.— OR — <instant> Remove this card and another one from your hand or discard pile.

You see a Wizard fleeing from a Dragon. He opens a portal and rides through, getting his bat knocked off by the edge of the gate. The Dragon follows, and the gate closes, You pick the hat up.

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• With the first effect, only abilities, artifacts, and spells can be exchanged, as only those have a corresponding deck to draw from. Statistics and specialties can not be removed.
  • 1 With the second effect, any card may be removed together with the Spellbinder's Hat.

<ongoing> During this Combat, neither player can use the <morale_positive> token or reroll Attack dice.— OR — <instant> +1 <power>

Walking through the ruins of an ancient walled city, you find the instrument of the city's destruction, the Spirit of Oppression.

docs.title: Opończa Przeciwstawienia
docs.text:
Major Artifact

<instant> Play this card immediately after an enemy casts a <spell>. If it was cast with 1 <power> or less, ignore the <spell> effect.— OR — <instant> Remove this card, then Search(1) <artifact>.

The Necromancer blasts the Paladin with a fire bolt, bringing him to his knees. You slay the evil one before the final blow. The grateful Paladin gives you the cloak that saved him.

docs.title: Miecz Ognia Piekielnego
docs.text:
Major Artifact

<instant> +3 <attack>. This unit suffers 1 <damage>. This effect cannot be used on an enemy unit.— OR — <instant> +4 <attack>. This unit suffers 2 <damage>. This effect cannot be used on an enemy unit.

During a sudden storm, a bolt of lightning strikes a tree, splitting it. Inside the tree you find a mysterious sword.

docs.title: Miecz Osądzenia
docs.text:
Relic Artifact

<instant> Discard X cards from hand to gain +X <attack>.— OR — <instant> Discard X cards from hand to gain +X <defense>.

A Paladin has been mortally wounded by a group of Zombies. He asks you to take his sword and finish what he started. As you pick it up, everything becomes a blur. The Zombies lie dead.

You come upon a bridge spanning a dry gully. As you begin to cross, a gigantic, maddened Ogre appears from the other side and charges toward you, forcing you to slay it. You decide to take its shield, as a trophy.

docs.title: Thunder Helmet
docs.text:
Relic Artifact

<instant> Select 1 Spell card from your discard pile and put it back into your hand.— OR — <ongoing> For this Combat, whenever you play a Spell card, draw 1 card from your M&M deck. After the Combat, Remove this card.

A glint of golden light catches your eye. Upon further investigation, you find a golden helm hidden under a bush.

docs.title: Pabncerz Tytanów
docs.text:
Relic Artifact

<instant> Discard 1 card to gain +4 <power>.— OR — <instant> +2 <power>.

A Titan stops you and says, "Pay me 5,000 Gold, or I shall slay you where you stand." You refuse. The Titan grabs the sword hanging from his belt, but you duck between his legs. He is so surprised by this maneuver that he trips, falling on his sword and killing himself, instantly. You relieve him of his belongings.

docs.title: Gladius Tytanów

<instant> Discard 1 card to gain +3 <attack>.— OR — <instant> +2 <attack>

docs.title: Trident of Dominion
docs.text:
Major Artifact

<instant> +2 <attack>— OR — <map_effect> If this Hero is on a Sea tile, draw 2 cards.

After a long search, you finally find a well. However, your soldiers cannot pull the water bucket out. Apparently, it is stuck. You order your banner carrier to go down and fix it. It turns out that a trident was blocking the way.

docs.title: Tunika Cyklopa Królewskiego
docs.text:
Major Artifact

<instant> Draw 1 card and gain +1 <power>.— OR — <instant> +2 <power>

You catch a Cyclops skinny dipping, and as a prank you make off with his clothes. Later, you realize the tunic is magical.

docs.title: Fiolka Krwi Życia
docs.text:
Major Artifact

<instant> Remove up to 3 <damage> from one of your units.— OR — <ongoing> For this Combat, your selected unit gains +1 <health_points>.

You find a mystical shrine hidden among the trees. Floating above the altar is a vial said to contain the Blood of Life. You very carefully remove it, taking care not to disturb anything else.

docs.title: Wozu z Amunicją
docs.text:
Astrologowie Ogłaszają

Until the next Astrologers round, each Ballista deals +1 <damage>, each First Aid Tent heals +1 <health_points>‍, and each Ammo Cart allows re-rolling 1 Attack die for all ranged units.

Wóz z Amunicją — najlepsza maszyna!Tylko ja posiadłem moc nieskończoności!Inne maszyny przy mnie są zerem!Dlaczego żaden heros nie ma mnie w specjalności?Bo sam powinienem być bohaterem! Łiiiiiiiiii!

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text: • Should the expert effect of Artillery be used during this week, it will deal 3 times 2 damage, so 6 damage in total.

docs.title: Wkurzającej Jaszczurki
docs.text:
Astrologowie Ogłaszają

Każdy gracz musi wtasować wszystkie karty Artefaktów i Zaklęć z ręki do swojej talii M&M, a następnie dobrać taką samą liczbę kart z wierzchu swojej talii M&M.

Tej, Bohaterze! Bohaterze! Tej, Bohaterze! Bohaterze! Tej!

docs.title: Ważkiego Ogiera
docs.text:
Astrologowie Ogłaszają

Until the next Astrologer's round:Each Hero gains +1 Movement.

Hej, Adrienne, udało mi się!

docs.title: Wiosennej Czystki
docs.text:
Astrologowie Ogłaszają

Each player must immediately discard all cards from their hand and draw the same number of cards.

- It's time for spring cleaning!- It's winter. We're in Eeofol... Duh...

docs.title: Lodowej Burzy
docs.text:
Astrologowie Ogłaszają

Ten efekt trwa do następnej rundy Astrologów. Wszystkie <spell> ze Szkół Magii Powietrza i Wody otrzymują +1 <power>.

A Sylvia wnet zapięła płaszcz,Zaklęła: — Ech, do czarta!Regańska flota nie ma szans!Ten sztorm to dzieło Kalta!

docs.title: Charliego i jego Cyrku
docs.text:
Astrologowie Ogłaszają

At the beginning of this round and the next one, each player can draw up to 3 cards from any Neutral Units deck(s) and Recruit one of them. The Players must still <pay> the recruitment cost and have the corresponding Dwelling in their Town(s). Shuffle the remaining cards back into their respective deck(s) afterwards.

Cześć, Bohaterze! Chcesz balonik? Jestem Charle, Tańczący Clown. Mam tu orków, trolle i inne niespodzianki. I baloniki we wszystkich kolorach!

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• Tą kartą nie można zrekrutować <azure> jednostek.
  • 1 When played with miniatures (e.g. such as when playing on the large battlefield), this ability cannot be used to recruit units from a faction controller by another player, nor to recruit neutral units that are already recruited by another player. Should a player draw such card, that may not be recruited, they shall draw a replacement card instead.

docs.title: Crag Hack
docs.text:
Astrologowie Ogłaszają

For the first Combat this round, all <unit_ground> units gain +1 <attack>. The faction controlling Crag Hack can Reinforce Goblins for free once.

Crag! Hack! Taste the flavor of my axe! Even my goblins strike like behemoths...

docs.title: Pomylonego Maga
docs.text:
Astrologowie Ogłaszają

Until the next Astrologers' round:The first Spell card player by each player is returned to the player's hand, instead of being discarded.

"I'm a flying pixie! Fly! Fly""Excuse me, Mr. Wizard, can you help us? We need to go to AvLee...""Sorry, kiddo, I don't do such stuff anymore. How about a hug? That's the best kind of magic there is!"

docs.title: Tańczącego Diablika
docs.text:
Astrologowie Ogłaszają

Each player can Remove a Statistic card from their discard pile or hand to gain 1 Empowered Statistic card of the same type.

Welcome to the hell hole, it gets worse here every day.Learn to live like a flame beast in the pit where we play.

docs.title: Martwej Ciszy
docs.text:
Astrologowie Ogłaszają

Nothing changes.

Hello silence, my old friend.I've come to chat with you again.

docs.title: Destruction
docs.text:
Astrologowie Ogłaszają

Each player who has a <permanent> card in play must Remove it and take 5 <gold>.

"I am Escaton the Destroyer also called 'Devil's Doom.' It is a doom you have brought on yourselves by failing to eliminate the devil Kreegans from your realms."

docs.title: Disruption
docs.text:
Astrologowie Ogłaszają

Starting from the first player, each player (if possible) can freely rotate 1 tile that has no Hero on it.No tile can be rotated more than once.If it is not possible to rotate even 1 tile, ignore this card and draw another one.

"The world doesn't revolve around you.Think of the others too, you fool."

docs.title: Elementals
docs.text:
Astrologowie Ogłaszają

For each Neutral Unit deck except Azure, discard until you find an Elemental. Place each Elemental face up on top of its deck. When the Elemental is defeated in Combat, put it back on top of its deck. Discard the Elements when this card is replaced.

The most powerful of all elements is the element of... surprise!— Tarnum

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text: • Any unit with the word "Elementals" in their name counts as an Elementals unit.

docs.title: Odkrywców
docs.text:
Astrologowie Ogłaszają

During this round, players do not draw cards at the start of their turns. Instead, each player draws cards up their <hand>. Then, each of them may discard any number of cards. For every 3 cards discarded this way, they can Remove one Statistic card and replace it with an Empowered Statistic card of the same type.

"We are explorers. The ones to delve into the unknown regions of experience. Demons to some, angels to others."

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text: • 1 The removed statistic needs to come from the player's hand. When taking the empowered statistic, player adds it to their hand.

docs.title: Zobacz też
docs.text:
• Lista kart Astrologowie Ogłaszają
  • List of Statistics

  1. Not officially confirmed by game designers, and is therefore considered a Community rule. ↩

docs.title: Fikuśnej Nimfy
docs.text:
Astrologowie Ogłaszają

Each player immediately gains 1 <morale_positive>

Więc postanowiłem los wziąc w swoje ręce,W ten sposób zdobyłem po raz pierwszy czyjeś serce,Byliśmy młodzi i byliśmy wolni,Poszliśmy na randkę do mej szkieletorniJej serce mam w kieszeni, my znamy się na wskroś,Przejrzałem ją na wylot, znam jej każdą kość!

docs.title: Puchatego Króliczka
docs.text:
Astrologowie Ogłaszają

Each player immediately rolls 1 Treasure die and gains the rolled bonus.

Hurry, hurry, get your free treasures, every treasure's a vote for Fluffy Rabbit!

docs.title: Czterdziestu Rozbójników
docs.text:
Astrologowie Ogłaszają

Ten efekt trwa do następnej rundy AstrologówGdy gracz ma dobrać kartę Wydarzenia, dobiera 2 karty zamiast 1. Jedną z nich rozpatruje, a drugą umieszcza na spodzie talii Wydarzeń.

W murowanej piwnicy tańczyli rozbójnicyNapadły ich ogórki — zrobili z nich kiszonkiW murowanej piwnicy posnęli rozbójnicyNapadły ich diabliki — zrobiły z nich szaszłyki

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text: • In a game without events this card is removed and another card is drawn instead.

docs.title: Przyjaznego Bobra
docs.text:
Astrologowie Ogłaszają

If you draw this card on the first Astrologers' round, discard it and draw another card.Immediately remove all Black cubes from all locations on the map.

"When the Sword of Frost touches Armageddon's Blade, the time of Enroth will be no longer then.""Do you know that doesn't really rhyme?"

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• Only the black cube are removed, the colored faction cubes remain on fields (e.g. mines).
  • A second grail token can not come into play with this card, even if the field with the grail would be made visitable again.

docs.title: Złotego Smoka
docs.text:
Astrologowie Ogłaszają

At the beginning of the next Resource round, all players gain 5 <gold>.

Gold, gold, gold, live it up to your love.Gold, gold, gold, live it up to your hope.Gold, gold, gold, live it up to your dream.Gold, gold, gold, live it up to your soul.

docs.title: Chciwego Smoka
docs.text:
Astrologowie Ogłaszają

Na początku najbliższej rundy Zasobów wszyscy gracze otrzymują o 1 <valuables> mniej (minimum 0).

Dracon, głupcze! Nigdy więcej nie drwij z żywego smoka!

docs.title: Ponurego Czarnoksiężnika
docs.text:
Astrologowie Ogłaszają

Until the next Astrologers' round:The first Spell card played in each player's turn gets +1 <power>.

Against the power of Eeofol, there can be no victory!

docs.title: Swingującego Satyra
docs.text:
Astrologowie Ogłaszają

Ten efekt trwa do następnej rundy Astrologów.Przed każdą Walką z Jednostkami Neutralnymi możesz odrzucić jedną z dobranych kart Jednostek Neutralnych i w jej miejsce dobrać inną kartę tego samego poziomu.

— Znasz może jakieś hity Heroes Orchestry?— Niestety, nie.— To doskonale, bo ten utwór nie przypomina żadnego z nich.

docs.title: Bohatera
docs.text:
Astrologowie Ogłaszają

Each player can <pay> 4 <gold> to Remove a Statistic card from their hand and replace it with an Empowered Statistic card of the same type. Each player may do so twice, but both exchanges must be made on the same turn. Once a player makes the exchange, they place their faction cube on this card to mark the fact.

"You are, without a doubt, the worst Hero I've ever head of!""But you have heard of me."

docs.title: Przyjaciół Isry
docs.text:
Astrologowie Ogłaszają

Each player can immediately Reinforce a unit on the "Few" side at half the cost.

I was all alone, once upon a time.With me, I only had a knife.But now, I have friends.Now, I have friends for live.

docs.title: Judge Dread
docs.text:
Astrologowie Ogłaszają

Until the next Astrologers' round, at the start of Combat with Neutral Units, the attacker can discard all of them and draw new Neutral Units.

Today, I am the law! Lower your forks! These peasants... are under... arrest!

docs.title: Mages
docs.text:
Astrologowie Ogłaszają

During this round, using the Spell Book token is free.You can use it even if you do not have a Mage Guild built.

"Did you hear? A local library is being closed, and they are giving spells away for free!""Let me guess, a Phoenix took over and fixed all the staff?"

docs.title: Magicznego Żółwia
docs.text:
Astrologowie Ogłaszają

Until the next Astrologer's round:Each Hero suffers -1 Movement.

Men live and die, and the Tortoise Moves. Empires grow and crumble, and the Tortoise Moves. Gods come and go, and still the Tortoise Moves. The Tortoise Moves.

docs.title: McGivera
docs.text:
Astrologowie Ogłaszają

At the beginning of the next round, each player can take 1 War Machine of their choice from the War Machines deck at not cost.

Hi, this is McGiver. We all know how the War Machines work, so when you hear the vrrrum, go for it.

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text: • The war machine will be chosen and taken in the resource round that follows the current astrologers proclaim round.

docs.title: Wesołego Skrzata
docs.text:
Astrologowie Ogłaszają

At the beginning of the next Resource round, all players gain 1 <valuables>.

"I wasn't aware that leprechaun gold vanishes." "How could it be else when you just have taken it from me...?"

docs.title: Multilingual Bron
docs.text:
Astrologowie Ogłaszają

Until the next Astrologers' round:Every time you use a unit's special ability that requires a roll, you can reroll it once.

Basilisks are trick beasts. Even though we speak with them in Polish, English, and Basilisk, we rarely see eye to eye. Last time we did, somebody got stoned and use the wrong tongue.

docs.title: Atak
docs.text:
Astrologowie Ogłaszają

Until the next Astrologers' round, every card that provides X <defense> provides X <attack> instead.

The best defense is a good offense.

docs.title: Pirates
docs.text:
Astrologowie Ogłaszają

Until the next Astrologers' round:Every time you win Combat other than Quick Combat, gain 1 <resource_die>.

There is a rumor among Pirates that an amazing treasure is buried somewhere by the Pirate King.

docs.title: Pięknego Bazyliszka
docs.text:
Astrologowie Ogłaszają

Każdy gracz może natychmiast Usunąć do 2 kart z ręki lub swojego stosu kart odrzuconych.

Odkąd zobaczyłem ciebieNie mogę iść, nie mogę wstaćW łuskach twych nie widzę siebieŚlepia twe nie dają spaćPrzez twe oczy, te oczy zielone skamieniaaaaaałem

docs.title: Plastic Tray
docs.text:
Astrologowie Ogłaszają

Until the next Astrologers' round:Units that take Defense roll no Attack dice to get +1 <defense>.

Hail to the plastic tray that protects our models.

docs.title: Olbrzymiej Obfitości
docs.text:
Astrologowie Ogłaszają

Ten efekt trwa do następnej rundy Astrologów.Limit kart na ręce każdego gracza wzrasta o 1.

Twe ręce karmią wygłodniałe żywoty mas dobrodzejstwami rogu obfitości...

docs.title: Restart
docs.text:
Astrologowie Ogłaszają

Until the next Astrologers' round:If you draw this card on the first Astrologer's round, discard it and draw another.Your hand <hand> is reduced by 2 to a minimum of 4.

"Someone whispered '111' to me and disappeared.What could this mean?"

docs.title: Rulebook
docs.text:
Astrologowie Ogłaszają

During this round:When you trigger Combat with Neutral Units, the enemy's strength corresponds to the game difficulty setting one level lower than it actually is. If you difficulty setting is Easy, ignore this card and draw another one.

I remember it was here... somewhere.

docs.title: Sanktuarium
docs.text:
Astrologowie Ogłaszają

During this round, Heroes cannot attack one another.If you are playing a Campaign scenario, ignore this card and draw another one.

"What are we trying to prove? What's the point? There are wounded Seamen out there. We can save them if we stop fighting!"

docs.title: Spalonej Ziemi
docs.text:
Astrologowie Ogłaszają

Until the next Astrologers round, all <spell> from the Earth Magic and Fire Magic Schools are cast at a +1 <power>.

And I miss you, like the scorched earth miss the rain.

docs.title: Pustelnika
docs.text:
Astrologowie Ogłaszają

Each player gains <morale_negative>.

Some Kreegan has told me: "Hell is other people."

docs.title: Zaklęcia
docs.text:
Astrologowie Ogłaszają

When you are about to Search the Spell deck, you can perform Search(4) the Spell deck instead.

Economic Assets. Strength of muscles. Political connections. Magic. Al forms of power are the same. Seving a single purpose: giving its possessor a broader spectrum of choices. Alternative courses of action... inevitably, more of them are wrong.

docs.title: Rączej Łasicy
docs.text:
Astrologowie Ogłaszają

Ten efekt trwa do następnej rundy Astrologów.Raz w turze każdy gracz może przerzucić kość Skarbów albo kość Zasobów.

By gnollem być, szkielety musisz miećTo żadna już tajemnicaDo sławy się ten Sandro znów pniePrzez całe dnie Hełm Czaszki kradnieJam nie łasica, a kawał licza!

docs.title: Paskudnej Plagi
docs.text:
Astrologowie Ogłaszają

Wszyscy gracze odwracają kartę wybranej jednostki ze strony "Grupy" na stronę "Garstki", jeśli to możliwe.

Pstryk! Ginie połowa populacji.

docs.title: Wesołego Życia Żołnierza
docs.text:
Astrologowie Ogłaszają

Each player can immediately search the Neutral Units deck and Recruit 1 chosen unit associated with their faction for free. Each player still needs to have the corresponding dwelling built in their town.

"My Lord, my Lady! We're at your command!"

docs.title: Wandering Merchant
docs.text:
Astrologowie Ogłaszają

Once during this round, each player can buy a War Machine as if they visited a Trading Post, but with a discount of 3 <gold>.

"Everything is easy as shooting fish in a barrel.All you need is to put fish in a barrel... preferably of a cannon.And, incidentally, I just happen to have one on sale!"

docs.title: Whirlpool
docs.text:
Astrologowie Ogłaszają

Until the next Astrologers' round, Whirlpools can be used without cost. Additionally, all Heroes can choose their Whirlpool exit tile instead of making a roll. If there is no Sea tile on the map, ignore this card and draw another one.

People assume that whirlpool is a tunnel, a strict progression from the entrance to the exit, but actually, from a non-linear, non-subjective viewpoint, it's more like a fitful funnel of wibbly-wobbly, whirly-whaley... Stuff.

docs.title: Białego Kruka
docs.text:
Astrologowie Ogłaszają

Każdy gracz natychmiast rzuca 1 kością Zasobów i rozpatruje jej wynik.

— Dokąd pomykasz ptaszyno z mych snów?— Do Eeofolu, Deyji, Wymiaru między wymiarami... A co, chcesz się przelecieć?

docs.title: Hulanek i Swawoli
docs.text:
Astrologowie Ogłaszają

At the beginning of the next Resource round, all players gain 5 less <gold>.

Sit down, there's a party in the tavern today!We are thirsty again!La la la!We drink for a week of Wild DebaucheryFor seven days now!La la la!

docs.title: Wind
docs.text:
Astrologowie Ogłaszają

Until the next Astrologers' round:All Heroes can continue their movement after entering a sea field from a land field. If there is no Sea tile on the map, ignore this card and draw another one.

Economic Assets. Strength of muscles. Political connections. Magic. Al forms of power are the same. Seving a single purpose: giving its possessor a broader spectrum of choices. Alternative courses of action... inevitably, more of them are wrong.

  • Negative Morale Cards

  • 2 Earth Elementals
  • 2 Fire Elementals
  • 2 Water Elementals

  • Leprechaun
  • Satyr
  • Steel Golem
  • 2 Ammo Carts
  • 2 Ballistas
  • 2 Cannons
  • 2 Catapults
  • 2 First Aid Tents
  • 10 Ships

docs.text:
• 48 Neutral Unit cards
  • 32 Empowered Ability cards

docs.title: Szemrana Aukcja
docs.text:
Wydarzenie

Repeat 3 times: Reveal the top card from the Artifact deck. In secret, each player takes as much <gold> in their hand as they are willing to pay for it. Then reveal your bets at the same time. The one with the highest proposal discards the <gold> and claims the card. If there are no bets or there is a tie, discard the card.

In the depth of the night, you come across a crowdy camp encircling a stage. On it, a corpulent man with a twirly mustache is shouting vigorously, "...and the vase goes to the lovely bearded lady in the back row! Now gaze upon this marvelous item I shed tears and blood to get! Not mine of course... The starting price is..."

docs.title: Handlarz Artefaktów
docs.text:
Wydarzenie

Draw 5 artifacts. You can buy either any number of them or the face-up card from the Artifact discard pile. After finishing, give the rest of the cards to the player on the left. The exchange goes on until the last card is bought or the cards return to the one who drew them. Minor Artifacts cards cost 3 <gold>, Major 5 <gold>, Relic 7 <gold>.

On your journey, you wander into a blacksmith's workshop. They welcome you with a cheerful laugh and present their wares.

docs.title: Krypta
docs.text:
Wydarzenie

Each player chooses one option: Gain Negative Morale. Then roll 2 <treasure>. If any of them shows <experience>, you gain nothing. Otherwise, resolve one result.— OR —Gain Positive Morale.— OR —Only for <necro>. Reinforce one of your <bronze> or <silver> for half the cost.

You tentatively approach the burial crypt of ancient warriors. Disturbing the peace of the dead is a dirty and despicable act. Yet, something of worth may be buried among these ancient graves...

docs.title: Przeklęte Bagno
docs.text:
Wydarzenie

Each player chooses one option: Gain Negative Morale. Then roll 2 <treasure> and choose one result.— OR —Remove one or more <spell> from your hand; if you remove at least 2, Search (3) the Artifact deck.— OR —Discard your cheapest unit.— OR —Only for <necro>. Reinforce one of your <bronze> or <silver> for free.

On your journey, you wander into a swamp. Only after some time do you notice the eerie atmosphere surrounding this place and the eyes lurking just beneath the water's surface. Eyes of the dead. Your army trembles in panic while you gather your thoughts. Will you force them to go on or, maybe, shield them with your magic?

docs.title: Zbójecka Kryjówka
docs.text:
Wydarzenie

Take the top 2 cards from a Neutral Unit deck of your choice. You may buy one of them. Then decide what to do with the remaining card(s) - you may place them at the bottom or top of the respective Neutral Unit deck.

Searching through the underbrush, you find the secret entrance to the Den of Thieves. In there, an old "acquaintance" grabs your arm and starts talking about all the "secrets" she has learned since you last meeting.

docs.title: Ogród Objawienia
docs.text:
Wydarzenie

Each player chooses one option: Draw 4 cards either from your discard pile or your deck. Then Remove any number of Spell or Ability cards from your hand. For every two cards removed this way, you can perform Search(2) the Spell deck or the Ability deck. After that, discard all cards from hand and draw up to your <hand>.— OR —Leave and gain nothing.

Beside the road you see a beautiful garden filled with flowers in full bloom. A monk sitting in the middle invites you to meditate with him.

docs.title: Biblioteka Oświecenia
docs.text:
Wydarzenie

For every player in the game, draw the top two Spell cards and put them face-up within all players' reach. Each player can buy once of these <spell> for 6 <gold> or 2 <valuables>.

In the town you are currently visiting, there is a famous library said to possess a vast collection of arcane tomes. Are you willing to seek their knowledge?

docs.title: Laboratorium Maga
docs.text:
Wydarzenie

For every player in the game, draw two Spell cards and place them face-up within all players' reach. Each player can buy one of these <spell> for 4 <gold> or 1 <valuables>. If a player buys a card, they immediately shuffle their deck and discard pile along with the newly bought card.

In the distance, you spot green smoke coming from a lonely tower in the middle of nowhere. When you approach, you are met by a lone mage in a tattered robe sitting by the entrance. Without looking at you, he says: "Tell me what your hea..." The mage hiccups. "...heart desires. And ale... isle... I'll prepare appperfect spell for that..." he gulps from a vial. "...Sooner'rr'laterr."

docs.title: Zaczarowany Gaj
docs.text:
Wydarzenie

Choose 1 Spell, Artifact, or Ability card from your hand and put it face-down on the table.— OR —Draw and view 1 card from the Spell, Artifact, or Ability deck and put it face-down on the table.When all players have added a card to the pool, shuffle it. Each player can now either take a card from the pool or gain 4 <gold>.

The sound of music lures you into a magical forest where you see a young person running through the wood. The elusive silhouette disappears whenever you get closer. Finally, you catch up and grab their arm... only to wake up and discover you were unconscious for several hours. Dejected, you rise from the moss with a strange feeling that something has changed.

docs.title: Jarmark Czasu
docs.text:
Wydarzenie

Each player chooses one option: Discard as many cards as you want, then draw new cards up to your <hand> +2. Remove any number of Ability or Spell cards from your hand. For every two cards removed this way, you can perform Search (2) the Artifact deck.— OR —Leave and gain nothing.

In the middle of a small town, you stumble upon a bustling and noisy market. Lured by the cheerful atmosphere, you start walking around. Each item on the display seems weird......after hours of wandering, you find yourself in the middle of the road, not sure when you left the market. When you turn around, you see just an empty road... not even a town in sight. Was all of that just a dream?

docs.title: Targowisko
docs.text:
Wydarzenie

Each player chooses one option: Roll 1 <resource_die> and resolve its effects.— OR —Trade resources using Trading Post rules.— OR —Propose an exchange of resources with other players - one type of resource for one type of resource. Each player can propose one deal.

While passing through a small town, you find a lively marketplace. Despite all the turmoil in the world, this place seems strangely cheerful and happy. Will you stop to see what they offer?

docs.title: Obóz Najemników
docs.text:
Wydarzenie

Each player can draw up to 2 Neutral Unit from one of the chosen decks. Then they are spread on the table, and each player can Recruit one of them.

You've come from a camp of mercenaries practicing their combat tactics. They welcome you and your troops and invite you to train with them. Sounds too good to be true...

docs.title: Posłaniec z Przesyłką
docs.text:
Wydarzenie

Each player draws 2 top cards from the Artifact deck and then chooses one option: Buy one of the cards. Minor Artifacts cards cost 3 <gold>, Major 5 <gold>, Relic 7 <gold>.— OR —Put them both on the Artifact discard pile to roll 2 <resource_die> and resolve one of them.

A lone rider on a battered horse catches up with your army.They dismount, pull out a small package, and stagger toward you.Gasping heavily, the messenger starts:"Your... delivery... arrived..." After that, they faint.You don't remember ordering anything...

docs.title: Przebiegły Skrzat
docs.text:
Wydarzenie

Pool 2 <treasure> and 2 <resource_die>, roll them, and put them within all players' reach. Starting from the player who drew this event, each player rolls 1 <treasure> and 1 <resource_die>. If they can match any of the pool's rolls, they may take one matching die from the pool and resolve its effects.

You are making your way through the dense forest when you stumble upon a mischievous magical creature - a leprechaun sitting on a pile of treasures."Answer my question and I shall part with some of these worthless trumpery. Now... what do I have in my pocket?"

docs.title: Więzienie
docs.text:
Wydarzenie

Draw 2 Neutral Unit cards from any deck (except for Azure). You can buy one of them or discard it to gain 3 <gold>. After that, pass the remaining card to the next player. That player also draws a Neutral Unit card from any deck (except for Azure) and repeats the rest of the process. The exchange goes on till every player has a chance to choose something.

In the town you have passed recently, you heard rumors of some people from your lands having been imprisoned by a local governor. In a dazzling display of daring, you break into the jail and free all imprisoned there. In return, some of them pledge loyalty to your cause.

docs.title: Szkoła Magii i Akademia Wojskowa
docs.text:
Wydarzenie

Each player chooses one option: Discard as many cards as you want, then draw new cards up to your <hand> +2. Remove any number of Ability or Spell cards from your hand. For every two cards removed this way, you can perform Search (2) the Ability deck or the Spell deck.— OR —Leave and gain nothing.

On your journey you happen upon two majestic buildings from which two figures emerge - an acolyte whose mere presence fills the air with a tingle of magic and a battle-scarred instructor, grunting between sentences. The both shout at passers-by: "Come and learn the secrets of mystical arts!" "No! Fancy tricks are for the weak. I touch what real warriors need!"

docs.title: Kapliczka Magicznej Myśli
docs.text:
Wydarzenie

For every player in the game, draw two random Spell cards and place them face-up within all players' reach. Each player can either buy one of these <spell> for 6 <gold> or 2 <valuables> or roll and resolve 1 <resource_die>. Place the remaining, not bought, cards in the Spell discard pile.

You come across a lavish shrine attended by a group of high priests. Their eyes are full of fear, and they beg you to chase away nearby monsters. In exchange for protection, they agree to teach you a sophisticated spell.

docs.title: Stajnie
docs.text:
Wydarzenie

Each player chooses one option: Your Main hero gains +1 <movement>.— OR — <pay> 1 <movement> from any of your heroes to roll 1 <resource_die>.

While traveling to your next location, you see a small fork in the road. Out of curiosity, you check it out and find an old stable. The overjoyed host offers you an amazing bargain.

docs.title: Prośba Wieśniaków
docs.text:
Wydarzenie

Each player chooses one option: Remove an Artifact or Spell card from your hand.— OR — <pay> 1 <building_materials>— OR — <pay> 5 <gold>— OR — <pay> 1 <movement> from any of your heroes.

In the distance, you see a small village covered in a cloud of smoke. Upon arrival, you are greeted only by charred ruins and the lamentations of families who lost all they had. Will you help them?

docs.title: Pomarszczony Pustelnik
docs.text:
Wydarzenie

Each player chooses one option: Name a resource that will not show on any of the dice, then roll 3 <resource_die>. If you are correct, resolve one of the dice. If you are wrong, choose one result and subtract it from you resources.— OR —Roll 1 <resource_die>. You may pay the indicated resources to Search(2) the Artifact deck.— OR —Leave and gain nothing.

You've found the humble dwelling of a withered hermit. The hermit tells you that he is willing to give his treasure to the first wise person he meets.

docs.title: Pole Zablokowane
docs.text: A blocked field is fully enclosed by a thick border and heroes are not allowed to enter it in general.

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• Blocked Field cannot be entered, but can be exited.
  • 1 Should a hero be allowed to enter a blocked field due to an effect, they may only pass through. That means that they are required to immediately use another movement point during the same turn to move out of the blocked field. If they would not be able to leave the field, they are not allowed to enter it.
  • 1 Should a hero need to retreat back to a blocked field, they are allowed to do so, as long as they have a spare movement point that they can use to also move out of the blocked field during the same turn. If they have no movement points left, they retreat back to the field they were standing on before moving to the blocked field instead.
  • A hero is not allowed to end their turn on a blocked field.
  • 1 A field that is occupied by a player's hero may be used by the player's other hero to pass through. This means the hero needs to have another movement point available after moving to the field. Fields occupied by the player's heroes follow the same rules as blocked fields.

docs.title: Creature Bank
docs.text:
Visitable Field

Please refer to individual Creature Banks for effects.

A Creature Bank is not just a single field, it more of a field type, as there are multiple Creature Banks, each with their own set of guard Units and rewards. They can be either placed on the Far (Ⅱ-Ⅲ) Map tiles or on the Near (Ⅳ-Ⅴ) Map tiles, based on the Roman numerals printed on the back of each Creature Bank token.

docs.title: Walka
docs.text:
P - Player Deployment ZoneN - Guards (Neutral Units) Deployment Zone

When starting Combat at a Creature Bank, the player can place up to 5 of their units in the player deployment zone. Neutral guard units corresponding to the Creature Bank being visited are then placed randomly in the guards deployment zone. There is no round limit for challenging the Creature Bank guards.

docs.title: Difficulty
docs.text:
The game difficulty level affects the units guarding the Creature Bank by distributing Stacked tokens randomly among them. There can only be one token per unit. Each token increased a single statistic of a unit the following way:

  • +1 <attack>
  • +1 <defense>
  • +1 <health_points>
  • +2 <initiative>

Each difficulty increases the amount of tokens distributed. The more Stack units there are, the greater the loot once all the guards are defeated.

Difficulty Tokens Easy 1 Normal 2 Hard 3 Impossible 4

• Ⅰ and Ⅳ - this can only be played on a pack of Skeletons or Zombies, adding another amount to them, named "Horde".
  • Ⅳ - the abilities of the Pack of Zombies become inactive if they are upgraded to a "Horde". Once the "Horde" is defeated and they become a "Pack" again, their abilities function as usual.
  • Ⅵ - can be played on "Few", "Pack", or even "Horde" of Skeletons.
  • 1 Ⅵ - If the Skeletons are upgraded to a "Legion", they may be further upgraded to a "Pack" or a "Horde", but the "Legion" stays on top and its statistics are applied until defeated.

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text: • Should a unit use the alternative action, they are not allowed to move, attack or defend.

docs.title: Statystyki
docs.text:
All units have the following statistics shown on their cards.

Symbol Name Meaning <attack> Attack How much damage this unit will deal to another unit. <defense> Defense Decreases the damage received from non-magical sources — damage received cannot be less than 0. <health_points> Health Points How much damage this unit can receive, before being removed from Combat. <initiative> Initiative How fast the unit is. Higher number means they'll get to activate sooner in Combat.

docs.title: Damage
docs.text:
Also shown as <damage>.

Should a unit receive damage from any source, it will be subtracted from its health points directly. The defense value only reduces the attack value of the attacking unit, but not the damage received of the unit that is being attacked.

docs.title: Przeszkoda
docs.text: Any space that is occupied by a unit, an obstacle marker, a Wall or a Gate may not be stepped on. Flying units may move through these spaces, but their movement is not allowed to end in such a space.

docs.title: Round
docs.text:
A combat round is a complete cycle of activations during Combat. At the start of a round, determine the order of activation for all participating units, usually by their <initiative> value from highest to lowest.

During a round, each eligible unit normally gains one activation in this order. When a unit activates, it may move and/or perform actions as allowed by the rules of the game. After all units that can act this round have taken their activation (or passed), the round ends.

When a new round begins, repeat the process of determining activation order if required by the scenario or rules. Some effects or abilities may last until the end of the current round or trigger at the start or end of a round.

docs.title: Kości
docs.text: There are 3 types of dice used throughout the game.

docs.title: Kość Ataku
docs.text:
A die most commonly used during Combat to modify the damage dealt or resolve a special ability of a Unit.

Side Count Effect -1 2 -1 <attack>. 0 2 No change to <attack>. +1 2 +1 <attack>

docs.title: Kość Zasobów
docs.text:
A Resource die (also shown as <resource_die>) is used to determine how much of which Resource the Player gains. Each side is unique and all 3 Resources are represented equally, with each having a lower value and a higher value, where the higher value is double of the lower one.

Wyniki 3 <gold> 6 <gold> 2 <building_materials> 4 <building_materials> 1 <valuables> 2 <valuables>

docs.title: Kość Skarbów
docs.text:
The Treasure Die (also shown as <treasure>) is commonly used to reward the Player.

Side Count Effect <experience> 2 The player’s Main Hero gains half an Experience Level. <artifact> 2 Search(2) the Artifact deck. <resource_die> 1 Roll and resolve 1 Resource die. 2 <resource_die> 1 Roll 2 Resource dice and choose one result.

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text: • When resolving a special ability of a Unit or something outside of Combat, the typical effects of each side are instead replaced by whatever other mechanic is currently requiring an Attack die roll.

docs.title: Dwelling
docs.text: A building that can be built in your town that allows you to recruit units of the corresponding tier ( <bronze>, <silver>, or <golden>).

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text: • Dwellings have to be built in the following order: <bronze> <silver> <golden>.

docs.title: <power> Empower
docs.text: This mechanic is specifically tied to spells. The more power a spell has, the stronger its effect can be. Depending on the effect, the empowered spell can deal more damage, provide stronger protection, affect higher tiers of Units, etc. Each spell already comes with an option of being used to empower other spells, instead of being used for its usual effect.

docs.title: Morale
docs.text:
Players can gain or lose morale through various game effects.

Here is a quick reference of what happens to the player's morale depending on what their starting morale was.

Current Morale Effect Outcome Neutral Morale Gain <morale_positive>. <morale_positive> Neutral Morale Gain <morale_negative>. <morale_negative> <morale_positive> Gain <morale_positive>. <morale_positive>You may spend existing token right before gaining a new one. <morale_positive> Gain <morale_negative>. Neutral Morale <morale_negative> Gain <morale_positive>. Neutral Morale <morale_negative> Gain <morale_negative>. Neutral MoraleDiscard your hand of cards the next time you end your Turn.

docs.title: Positive
docs.text:
Also shown as <morale_positive>.

A Positive Morale Token may be spent to perform any of these actions at any time (including right before gaining a second Positive Morale Token):

  • Draw a Card from your Deck.
  • Discard any number of Cards, then draw that many Cards.
  • Reroll any Die you have thrown.

docs.title: Negative
docs.text:
Also shown as <morale_negative>.

A Negative Morale Token cannot be spent to perform any action. Players can only get rid of it by gaining a Positive Morale Token or another Negative Morale Token. Gaining a second Negative Morale Token will result in the player having to discard their hand of cards the next time they would end their Turn.

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text: • The Necropolis <necro> ignores any changes in Morale. They can neither gain nor lose Morale.

docs.title: Przeszkoda
docs.text: Any space that is occupied by a unit, an obstacle marker, a Wall or a Gate may not be stepped on. Flying units may move through these spaces, but their movement is not allowed to end in such a space.

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• A paralyzed unit skips its next activation. Instead of activating, the <paralysis> token is removed from it.
  • The <paralysis> token is removed prematurely if the paralyzed unit receives damage. An attack that does not apply any damage does not count towards this.
  • If the paralyzed unit received damage from an attack, it will retaliate (if not done so prior during this Combat round).

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• A card with a permanent effect is played from hand, just like any other card. The cards stays on the field after being played, its effect lasting continuously, and it does not go to the discard pile.
  • The player may decide to put an active permanent card into their discard pile. This stops the card effect immediately.
  • Each player can only have a single active permanent card at any time. Should they play a new one, the currently active one goes into their discard pile and the newly played card takes its place.

docs.title: Remove
docs.text: Removing a card is the act of taking a card from the specified location and removing it from the game, for the rest of its duration. This means that neither you nor any other player may interact in any way with the removed card, except looking at the card.

docs.title: Tryb Starcia
docs.text:
A fully competitive mode for 2-3 players.

Name Players Description All For One 3 Three life-long friends become enemies, when each inherits a portion of the kingdom, following the King’s death. You must show your former friends how to rule... through conquest. Brave New World 2-3 A great upheaval shook the very foundations of the world, breaking apart continents and dividing territories in new breaking apart continents and dividing territories in new ways. After the earth stood still once more, the people crawled out from their hiding places and have begun rebuilding this Brave New World. Carpe Diem 2 A few years back, the Gods decided they no longer wanted any part in this world. Now there is total anarchy. Everybody blames everyone else for the gods abandoning them. While sitting in the throne room, you decided you are the only person fit to rule. Dwarven Gold 2-3 Dwarven gold madness swept the region when Invis Smythers (renowned Dwarven miner) struck it lucky when he found a gold vein worth 75,000 gold pieces. Local lords have started mounting expeditions. Manifest Destiny 3 The neighboring lands have become increasingly more crowded. Only one kingdom is fit to rule the others. It is time to show the other petty nobles it is your manifest destiny to rule this land. Monk’s Retreat 2 The monks who ruled this area of the world for years, have finally been pushed back to their islands. As one of the lords just freed by the monk’s retreat, you feel it is up to you to unite these lands under your rule. Search For The Grail 2-3 The Grail is said to have been lost somewhere in the area, and you have been charged with finding and retrieving it. But beware! The minions of your enemies are also seeking to lay their hands on it!

docs.title: Kampania
docs.text:
A single player mode of interconnected Scenarios against an enemy AI.

Name Scenarios Faction Description Long Live The Queen 1. Homecoming2. Guardian Angels3. Steadwick’s Liberation Castle Our landing has confirmed both our rumors and fears. With the death of my father, Erathia’s lands are being greedily divided by her neighbors. Dragon’s Blood 1. Savaging The Scavengers2. Blood Of The Dragon Father3. Blood Thirsty Dungeon Overlord Mutare, an ambitious Nighon Lady, wishes to take her rightful place among the ranks of powerful Nighon Lords. In Nighon, you don’t inherit your lands - you take them from those too weak to hold them. Only the strong are fit to rule, and the bones of the weak litter the tunnels of Nighon. Rise Of The Necromancer 1. Target2. Master3. Duke Alarice Necropolis Sandro must fight his way past his old master and several other lords who want the artifacts he carries. Once in Deyja he will make allies and soon rise to the top of the Deyja hierarchy. The Dragon Slayer 1. Crystal Dragons2. Rust Dragons3. Faerie Dragons4. Azure Dragons Tower The way of a Dragon Slayer is harm’s way. To prove himself one, Dracon has to rise to a handful of perilous challenges, and defeating a Crystal Dragon is but the first step. Once it is made, Dracon will have to seek out and battle the greatest wyrm to have ever lived, as only when the Azure Dragon perishes can Dracon truly call himself a Dragon Slayer. Playing With Fire 1. Farming Towns2. March Of The Undead3. Burning Of Tatalia Fortress After the Restoration of Erathia, the necromantic cult of Lord Haart was made illegal, and its members went underground. Cultists resurrected their leader and decided to move to Tatalia.At the same time, after receiving lessons from clerics in Steadwick - the Erathian capital, the witch Adrienne returns to her homeland - Tatalia. Her brethren treat her with distrust also because she specializes in fire magic, rare in Tatalia. She discovers a Death Knight is turning the local population into a harvesting ground for Undead. Restore the land and hunt down this evil. Utter extermination of the undead plague is your ultimate goal. Dead-Cold Revenge 1. Search For A Killer2. Final Peace3. Agents Of Vengeance Rampart TWhen two AvLee lords are found dead, Gem and Gelu set out on their vengeful quest to seek justice. Their fates, however, unexpectedly lead them to find much more than they had hoped for. Will they manage to foil the sinister plot brewing on AvLee borders, or has the gruesome discovery come too late to stop the Necromancers’ schemes?

docs.title: Tryb Sojuszu
docs.text:
A 2 versus 2 team-based mode. You will need an expansion pack with a town to play a 4-player game.

Name Description Arrogance Once, centuries ago, the world was at peace. Four cultures lived in harmony and freely associated with each other. Then you came into power and realized things would be better for you if you took over the entire world. Tale Of Two Lands The continents of East and West Varesburg have decided to wage war one last time. Securing the resources of your continent (with help from your ally) and then moving on to the other as quickly as possible is the best strategy for the battle of the Varesburgs. The Challenge The king has just revealed that it is only a matter of months before he passes away. For that reason he announced that whoever rises to the challenge of building the grail structure in the capital city of Osha within the next six months will be anointed as his successor. The gauntlet has been thrown, will you take it up?

docs.title: Tryb Kooperacyjy
docs.text:
A Cooperative mode for 2-3 players where everyone shares the same goal.

Name Players Description Gelea’s Champions 2-3 You and your ally have been invaded by warlords from another world. The time has come to strike back. Gather your forces and make temporary alliances to pile up resources in order to save the realm! Unholy Quest 2-3 Deep below the surface lurk monsters, the likes of which no one has ever seen before. Word is that the monsters are preparing to rise from the depths and lay claim to the surface world. Go forth and slay their evil armies before they grow too large. You may be the world’s only hope!

docs.title: Zaklęcia
docs.text:
Also shown as <spell>.

Each spell has an effect that can be improved upon by Empowering ( <power>) it. This makes the effect of the spell stronger, at the expense of using extra cards to do so. In addition to their regular effects, any spell can also be discarded to provide +1 <power>. Spells are gained by Searching the Spell deck, either the Mage Guild, by visiting fields or by any other effect that lets the player do the Search.

docs.title: Zaklęcia Podstawowe
docs.text: Basic Spell Cards have the symbol of their School in one of its corners.

docs.title: Expert Spells
docs.text: Expert Spell Cards have the symbol of their School in all of its corners.

docs.title: Szkoły Magii
docs.text: All Spell Cards belong to one School: Air, Earth, Fire, or Water. The sole exception to this rule is the Magic Arrow spell, which can belong to any School (its School needs to be chosen at the time of casting it). Hero specialties are not considered Spells, even though some of them have a School of Magic.

docs.title: Tarcza Powietrzna
docs.text:
Basic Air Spell

<ongoing> Until the end of the Combat, the selected unit gains * when it is attacked by a <unit_ranged> unit. <power> 0 ➣ +1 <defense> <power> 1 ➣ +2 <defense> <power> 2 ➣ +3 <defense>— OR — <instant> +1 <power>

docs.title: Antymagia
docs.text:
Basic Earth Spell

<ongoing> Until the end of the Combat, the selected * unit cannot be targeted by spells: <power> 0 ➣ * <bronze> <power> 2 ➣ * <bronze> or <silver> <power> 4 ➣ * <bronze> or <silver> or <golden>— OR — <instant> +1 <power>

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text: • Units that are protected from spells via Anti-Magic are also immune to area effects of spells (e.g. Fireball spell).

docs.title: Szaleństwo
docs.text:
Expert Fire Spell

<ongoing> Select a * unit. In its activation, this unit must either attack the nearest unit or move to the nearest unit and attack it. <power> 0 ➣ * <bronze> <power> 2 ➣ * <silver> <power> 4 ➣ * <golden>— OR — <instant> +1 <power>

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• If there are multiple units that the shortest path away from the unit under this spell, the player owning the unit decides the direction of movement and the target of the attack.
  • Friendly units can also be attacked by the unit under this spell.
  • The attack of the unit under this spell does trigger a retaliation attack, even if the attacked unit was a friendly one.

docs.title: Błogosławieństwo
docs.text:
Basic Water Spell

<instant> The selected <unit_ground> or <unit_flying> unit: <power> 0 ➣ Ignores the Attack die roll. <power> 1 ➣ Ignores the Attack die roll and gains +1 <attack> <power> 2 ➣ Ignores the Attack die roll and gains +2 <attack>— OR — <instant> +1 <power>

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text: • If no Attack die is rolled during the attack, it also does not show any results. This means that any units that have abilities based on the result of an Attack die roll do not trigger. (e.g. the Zombies <defense> does not increase, and the Mummies cannot set the Attack die to "-1").

docs.title: Oślepienie
docs.text:
Basic Fire Spell

<activation> Place a <paralysis> token on the selected * unit: <power> 0 ➣ * <bronze> <power> 1 ➣ * <bronze> or <silver> <power> 2 ➣ * <bronze> or <silver> or <golden>— OR — <instant> +1 <power>

docs.title: Ręka Śmierci
docs.text:
Basic Fire Spell

<instant> The selected <unit_ground> or <unit_flying> unit gains: <power> 0 ➣ +1 <attack> <power> 1 ➣ +2 <attack> <power> 2 ➣ +3 <attack>— OR — <instant> +1 <power>

docs.title: Łańcuch Piorunów
docs.text:
Expert Air Spell

<activation> Select a unit and another 2 units closest to it. Allocate * <damage>, starting with the first selected unit. <power> 0 ➣ 1/1/1 <damage> <power> 2 ➣ 2/1/1 <damage> <power> 4 ➣ 3/2/1 <damage>— OR — <instant> +1 <power>

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• The <damage> from Chain Lightning also applies to friendly units.
  • If multiple units are the same distance away from the target of this spell, the caster chooses which one of them receives the second damage and which one receives the third.

docs.title: Clone
docs.text:
Expert Water Spell

<ongoing> Place a Clone token on an allied * unit and one on an empty space adjacent to that unit. The Cloned unit acts like the original one, but has only 1 <health_points>. <power> 1 ➣ * <bronze> <power> 3 ➣ * <bronze> or <silver> <power> 5 ➣ * <bronze> or <silver> or <golden>— OR — <instant> +1 <power>

docs.title: Kontratak
docs.text:
Expert Air Spell

<instant> Remove the Black cube from the selected * Unit card - that unit is now able to perform a Retaliation Attack action again: <power> 0 ➣ * <bronze> <power> 2 ➣ * <bronze> or <silver> <power> 4 ➣ * <bronze> or <silver> or <golden>— OR — <instant> +1 <power>

docs.title: Wzmocnienie
docs.text:
Basic Water Spell

<instant> Remove any effect or <paralysis> from the selected unit, and remove from this unit up to: <power> 0 ➣ 1 <damage> <power> 1 ➣ 2 <damage> <power> 2 ➣ 3 <damage>— OR — <instant> +1 <power>

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• 1 It is uncertain what it meant by "effect" here.
  • 2 Cure can only be cast on a friendly unit.
  • 2 The removal of an effect is optional. A positive effect does not have to be removed and may therefore remain active.

docs.title: Wrota Wymiarów
docs.text:
Expert Air Spell

<map_effect> Move a Hero up to * field(s). Ignore any obstacles and fields in-between and resolve the last one normally. <power> 0 ➣ *1 <power> 2 ➣ *2 <power> 4 ➣ *3— OR — <instant> +1 <power>

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• Dimension Door can only move the caster's Hero, not a Hero controlled by any other player.
  • May be used to jump over blocked fields.
