docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text: • Global effects that are not bound to a specific unit (e.g. Archery) may not be removed.

docs.title: Uwagi

docs.title: Magiczna Strzała
docs.text:
Basic Spell

<activation> The selected unit suffers: <power> 0 ➣ 1 <damage> <power> 1 ➣ 2 <damage> <power> 2 ➣ 3 <damage>— OR — <instant> +1 <power>

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• Magic Arrow is considered a basic spell, despite having a magic symbol in each corner.
  • Magic Arrow can benefit from spell power bonus to any school of magic, but it can only be affected by a single school of magic at a time.
  • 1 If a unit ignores a specific school of magic (it's immune to spells of that school of magic), it can not ignore the Magic Arrow.

docs.title: Magic Mirror

Expert Air Spell

<instant> When your * unit is about to be targeted or damaged by a <spell>, choose a new target for that <spell>. <power> 0 ➣ * <bronze> <power> 1 ➣ * <bronze> or <silver> <power> 2 ➣ * <bronze> or <silver> or <golden>— OR — <instant> +1 <power>

docs.title: Uniesienie
docs.text:
Expert Water Spell

<ongoing> You can reroll each of your Attack dice once. During: <power> 0 ➣ This Activation <power> 2 ➣ This Combat round <power> 4 ➣ This Combat— OR — <instant> +1 <power>

docs.title: Pech
docs.text:
Basic Fire Spell

<instant> Play immediately when the selected * enemy unit is attacking. Negate an Attack die result or an additional <attack> from any card. <power> 0 ➣ * <bronze> <power> 1 ➣ * <bronze> or <silver> <power> 2 ➣ * <bronze> or <silver> or <golden>— OR — <instant> +1 <power>

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• The card has to be played immediately after declaring the attack, before other cards are played.
  • The result of the Attack die roll is negated, as well as all future effects that increase the <attack> of the attacking unit.
  • Misfortune can not be played to negate effects of cards that were already played and have already increased the <attack> of the attacking unit. The players should mutually agree if they can no longer play Misfortune after the other effects were played, or if the opponent gets to take his played <attack>-enhancing cards back into their hand.

docs.title: Psalm Mocy
docs.text:
Expert Water Spell

<instant> The selected unit gains * <attack>, <defense>, or <initiative>: <power> 0 ➣ *+1 <power> 2 ➣ *+2 <power> 4 ➣ *+3— OR — <instant> +1 <power>

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• Prayer only increases one of the three values, the caster gets to choose which one.
  • Prayer can be cast at any point during the Combat as an instant. This way a player may increase the initiative of a unit outside of their turn, causing the turn order to be adjusted immediately.

docs.title: Precyzja
docs.text:

Basic Water Spell

<instant> Play this card after * from the School of Water Magic is cast to ignore that spell's effect. <power> 0 ➣ *a Basic Spell <power> 1 ➣ *a Basic or an Expert Spell— OR — <instant> +1 <power>

docs.title: Quicksand
docs.text:
Basic Earth Spell

<ongoing> Shuffle up to * Quicksand tokens and place them face down on chosen empty spaces. Once placed, you can look at your tokens (See Stronghold rulebook). <power> 0 ➣ 2 <power> 1 ➣ 4 <power> 2 ➣ 6— OR — <instant> +1 <power>

docs.title: Usunięcie Przeszkody
docs.text:
Basic Water Spell

<instant> Remove * obstacles (except units) from the Combat board. <power> 0 ➣ *1 <power> 1 ➣ *2 <power> 2 ➣ *3— OR — <instant> +1 <power>

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• Units can not be removed by this spell, despite counting as obstacles for movement purposes.
  • Only the wall, the gate, and obstacle markers (on the large battlefield) may be removed by this spell.

docs.title: Wskrzeszenie
docs.text:
Expert Earth Spell

<instant> Cancel an attack that would reduce your * unit's <health_points> to 0. You can cast this spell immediately after the enemy unit's attack. <power> 0 ➣ * <bronze> <power> 2 ➣ * <bronze> or <silver> <power> 4 ➣ * <bronze> or <silver> or <golden>— OR — <instant> +1 <power>

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• Only damage from an attack can be nullified. If the health points are reduced by other means of damage (such as abilities, spells, specialties, etc.), Resurrection cannot be played.
  • If damage from an attack is nullified, the resurrected unit will not retaliate, even if it has not performed a retaliation this round.

docs.title: Ofiara
docs.text:
Expert Fire Spell

<activation> Choose 1 of your * units. You can transfer up to as much <damage> from this unit to another one in your army, as much is needed for the other unit to perish. <power> 0 ➣ * <bronze> <power> 2 ➣ * <bronze> or <silver> <power> 4 ➣ * <bronze> or <silver> or <golden>— OR — <instant> +1 <power>

docs.title: Tarcza
docs.text:
Basic Earth Spell

<instant> The defending unit gains * against a <unit_ground> or <unit_flying> unit. <power> 0 ➣ *+1 <defense> <power> 1 ➣ *+2 <defense> <power> 2 ➣ *+3 <defense>— OR — <instant> +1 <power>

docs.title: Inkantacja Mocy
docs.text:
Expert Fire Spell

<instant> When attacking a <golden> unit, roll an Attack die * and apply all the results (except for a "-1"). After resolving this <attack>, draw 1 card. <power> 0 ➣ *twice <power> 2 ➣ *4 times <power> 4 ➣ *6 times— OR — <instant> +1 <power>

docs.title: Spowolnienie
docs.text:
Basic Earth Spell

<ongoing> Until the end of the Combat, the selected unit suffers: <power> 0 ➣ -1 <initiative> <power> 1 ➣ -2 <initiative> <power> 2 ➣ -3 <initiative>— OR — <instant> +1 <power>

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text: • 1 On the small battlefield, only the initiative of the unit is decreased, not its movement range. On the Battlefield Expansion, the initiative is used to determine the movement range, therefore a unit under this spell has its movement range decreased as well.

docs.title: Zobacz też
docs.text:
• Szkoła Ziemi
  • List of Spells

  1. Exceptions for specific game modes. This explanation is not valid for all game modes. The specific variant for the game mode is mentioned in the text. ↩

<instant> When a * unit is about to activate, skip this unit's activation. <power> 0 ➣ * <bronze> <power> 2 ➣ * <bronze> or <silver> <power> 4 ➣ * <bronze> or <silver> or <golden>— OR — <instant> +1 <power>

docs.title: Teleport
docs.text:
Expert Water Spell

<activation> During Combat, move one allied * unit to any empty space - ignore any obstacles or effects when moving. <power> 0 ➣ * <bronze> <power> 1 ➣ * <bronze> or <silver> <power> 2 ➣ * <bronze> or <silver> or <golden>— OR — <instant> +1 <power>

docs.title: Magiczny Portal
docs.text:
Expert Earth Spell

<map_effect> Move your Hero to a selected Town or Settlement in your control, and: <power> 0 ➣ No additional effect <power> 2 ➣ +1 <movement> <power> 4 ➣ +2 <movement>— OR — <instant> +1 <power>

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text: • 1 If the selected town already has a hero in it, and the teleporting hero would not be able to move out of the city during this turn, they can not teleport to the town.

docs.title: Zobacz też

  1. Not officially confirmed by game designers, and is therefore considered a Community rule. ↩

docs.title: Zasoby Ziemi
docs.text:
Basic Earth Spell

<instant> Choose enemy Mine within * fields. Replace the owner's cube with yours. <power> 0 ➣ *1 <power> 1 ➣ *2 <power> 2 ➣ *3— OR — <instant> +1 <power>

docs.title: Wizja
docs.text:
Basic Fire Spell

<instant> Draw * from any Neutral Unit deck. You can discard any of them and return the remaining cards in any order. <power> 0 ➣ *1 card <power> 1 ➣ *2 cards <power> 2 ➣ *3 cards— OR — <instant> +1 <power>

docs.title: Water Walk
docs.text:
Expert Water Spell

<map_effect> Choose one of your Heroes. They gain * and can continue their movement after entering a sea field from a land field. <power> 0 ➣ *+0 <movement> <power> 1 ➣ *+1 <movement> <power> 2 ➣ *+2 <movement>— OR — <instant> +1 <power>

docs.title: Kafelki
docs.text: Each map tile is divided into 7 separate fields that your heroes can visit.

docs.title: Tabela Trudności
docs.text:
Each map tile has Roman numerals written on its back, which indicates the difficulty of encounters on that tile. Roman numerals written on a field indicate that the field is guarded by neutral enemies that must be fought to visit it.

Here is a quick reference table to shows how many units of each tier are guarding a specific field. The columns indicate game difficulty, whereas the rows are showing encounter difficulty.

docs.title: Budynki
docs.text:
Towns have a multitude of buildings that can be built there. Some of them have the same functionality across all factions, and provide faction-specific effects.

Below is a brief overview of the various building types.

Symbol Type Effect <city_hall> City Hall Provides a faction-specific bonus at the beginning of each Resource Round. <citadel> Citadel Unlocks Reinforcing units. When under siege, add 3 Walls, 1 Gate, and 1 Arrow Tower cards to the Combat board. <mage_guild> Mage Guild Search the <spell> deck when built, and then each Turn once for a <gold> price. <bronze> Bronze Dwelling Unlocks Recruiting of <bronze> units. <silver> Silver Dwelling Unlocks Recruiting of <silver> units.Requires <bronze> Dwelling to be built before. <golden> Gold Dwelling Unlocks Recruiting of <golden> units.Requires <silver> Dwelling to be built before. <special_tent> Special Building Faction-specific effect. <special_gears> Special Building Faction-specific effect.

docs.title: Tiers
docs.text:
Units are divided into 4 tiers, based on their level of power:

  • <bronze> - Bronze tier
  • <silver> - Silver tier
  • <golden> - Gold tier
  • <azure> - Azure tier - only Neutral Units exist in this tier

docs.title: Statystyki
docs.text:
All units have the following statistics shown on their cards.

Symbol Name Meaning <attack> Attack How much damage this unit will deal to another unit. <defense> Defense Decreases the damage received from non-magical sources — damage received cannot be less than 0. <health_points> Health Points How much damage this unit can receive, before being removed from Combat. <initiative> Initiative How fast the unit is. Higher number means they'll get to activate sooner in Combat.

docs.title: Symbols
docs.text:
The following symbols are commonly used with the association of units or their abilities.

Symbol Meaning <power> Spell Power <damage> Damage <unit_passive> Effect is always active. <activation> Effect activates when this unit activates. <unit_other> Effect can be activated instead of moving and attacking. <unit_attack> Effect activates when this unit attacks another unit. <unit_retaliation> Effect activates when this unit retaliates against an attacker. <map_effect> Effect can be activated outside of Combat.

docs.title: Typy
docs.text:
There are 3 types of units:

  • <unit_ground> Ground Units
  • <unit_ranged> Ranged Units
  • <unit_flying> Flying Units

docs.title: Ground Units
docs.text:
Also shown as <unit_ground>.

Units that move on the ground and can only attack adjacent units.

  • 1 Ground units may move up to 3 spaces in Combat on the small battlefield. On the large battlefield, their movement range is equal to their <initiative> value instead.
  • Ground units may move first and then attack during their activation.

docs.title: Ranged Units
docs.text:
Also shown as <unit_ranged>.

Units that move on the ground and can also attack units that are not adjacent to them.

  • 1 Ranged units may move up to 1 space in Combat on the small battlefield. On the large battlefield, their movement range is equal to their <initiative> value instead.
  • 1 Ranged units may attack first, and then move. On the large battlefield they can either move or attack.
  • Should an enemy unit occupy any space that is adjacent to the ranged unit, the ranged unit can only attack the adjacent unit.
  • Should there be no enemy unit adjacent to the ranged unit, the ranged unit may attack an enemy unit anywhere on the battlefield.
  • 1 Should the ranged attack originate in the back row of the battlefield and the attacked unit is in the opposite back row of the battlefield, a ranged penalty applies. On the large battlefield, the ranged penalty applied when attacking a unit that is 8 or more hexes away.
  • There is no retaliation against a ranged attack. There is, however, retaliation if the ranged unit attacks a unit that is adjacent to it.

docs.title: Jednostki Latające
docs.text:
Also shown as <unit_flying>.

Flying units move through the air and can only attack adjacent units.

  • 1 Flying units may move up to 3 spaces in Combat on the small battlefield. On the large battlefield, their movement range is equal to their <initiative> value instead.
  • 1 Flying units may attack first, and then move. On the large battlefield, their movement always comes first.
  • Flying units may move first and then attack during their activation.
  • Flying units may move over obstacles, as long as their movement ends on an empty space.

docs.title: Non-Town Units
docs.text: Normally, units are part of a Town in which they can be Recruited, but there are some exceptions.

docs.title: Neutral Units
docs.text:
Neutral units are variants of regular units, expect they are only used in Neutral Unit Combat. There are some Ability, Astrologers Proclaim, Event, and Hero specialty cards that allow the player to Recruit Neutral Units.

There are neutral units that are only used when challenging the guards of a Creature Bank. None of these guard units can be Recruited normally, but some can be gained as a reward for defeating the guards of a Creature Bank.

docs.title: Summoned Units
docs.text:
These units can only comes into Combat by someone casting a summoning spell. None of these units can be Recruited normally.

There are currently 4 summoning spells:

  • Summon Air Elemental
  • Summon Earth Elemental
  • Summon Fire Elemental
  • Summon Water Elemental

docs.title: Pozostałe Jednostki
docs.text:
Although these are not strictly speaking Units, they can be part of Combat and have either Unit-like statistics or effects.

  • Arrow Tower
  • War Machines

docs.title: Lista Jednostek

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• Pack - The effects of the player's own spells and specialties are also ignored.
  • Pack - Specialties are the hero-specific cards (Ⅰ, Ⅳ, and Ⅵ).
  • Neutral - The first attack targets a unit directly in front of the Black Dragons. The second attack targets the unit directly behind the primary target in a straight line. There is no choice here.
  • Neutral - The target of the second attack does not carry out a retaliation attack against the Black Dragons, as it is not adjacent to it.
  • Neutral - Should the Black Dragons attack two units in a line, both of the attacks are resolved first. The retaliation attack will only be carried out after the secondary attack of Black Dragons has been resolved.
  • Neutral - Should the Black Dragons attack a unit, and the unit directly behind the primary target in a straight line happens to be a friendly unit, then the friendly unit will be the target of their secondary attack.
  • Neutral - Should the Black Dragons attack a Wall, no secondary attack will take place. Units behind the Wall are protected. Should they attack a unit directly in front of a Wall, the Wall will not take any damage.
  • Dragon Utopia - "its gains +3 <attack>" is a typo, it should say "it gains +3 <attack>".

docs.title: Dżiny
docs.text: GarstkaGrupaNeutralne Statistics Few Pack Neutral Town Tower Tower Neutral Tier <silver> <silver> <silver> Type <unit_flying> <unit_flying> <unit_flying> <attack> 3 4 3 <defense> 1 1 1 <health_points> 6 6 4 <initiative> 7 8 9 Cost 8  <gold> 12  <gold> 11  <gold> Abilities <unit_other> Discard 3 cards from your deck and take a  <spell> discarded this way to your hand. <unit_attack> Discard up to 3 cards from your deck and take a  <spell> discarded this way to your hand. <unit_attack> When attacking Efreet, this unit gains +1  <attack>.

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• Few - Should the Genies use their alternative action, they are not allowed to move, attack or defend.
  • Few - Exactly 3 cards are discarded from the deck.
  • Pack - Up to 3 cards are discard from the deck. The cards are discarded one after another. The player may decide to stop discarding cards at any time before they reach 3 cards and take a spell discarded this way to their hand.
  • Few and Pack - Should there not be enough cards to discard from the deck, the cards already discarded by the currently resolving ability are used to form the new discard pile. The old discard pile is then shuffled back into deck, and the remaining cards are discarded. The spell is then taken from the discarded cards.

docs.title: Upiorne Smoki
docs.text: GarstkaGrupaNeutralne Statistics Few Pack Neutral Town Necropolis Necropolis Neutral Tier <golden> <golden> <golden> Type <unit_flying> <unit_flying> <unit_flying> <attack> 6 7 5 <defense> 3 3 2 <health_points> 8 9 6 <initiative> 9 14 9 Cost 19  <gold>1  <valuables> 32  <gold>2  <valuables> 28  <gold> Abilities <activation> Discard the enemy's  <morale_positive> token. <activation> Discard the enemy's  <morale_positive> token. <unit_attack> Add +1 to your Attack die result. <unit_attack> After the attack, roll 1 Attack die; if the result is "0", the target must immediately move away 1 space.

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• Pack - First the +1 is added to the Attack die result, before other effects are applied, such as the effect of the Centaur's Axe.
  • Neutral - The player od the attacked unit gets to decide, where the unit moves. The new field must be empty and must not be adjacent to the Ghost Dragons. If there is no such field, the attacked unit stays in place.
  • Neutral - If the attacked unit was unable to move away, retaliation attack will take place. Otherwise it would not take place, as the unit would not longer be adjacent to the Ghost Dragons.

docs.title: Złote Smoki
docs.text: GarstkaGrupaNeutralneDragon Utopia Statistics Few Pack Neutral Dragon Utopia Town Rampart Rampart Neutral - Tier <golden> <golden> <golden> - Type <unit_flying> <unit_flying> <azure> <unit_flying> <attack> 5 6 6 5 <defense> 3 3 3 2 <health_points> 9 10 9 6 <initiative> 10 16 10 10 Cost 22  <gold>1  <valuables> 30  <gold>2  <valuables> 42  <gold> - Abilities <unit_attack> Attack 2 spaces in a line. The first attack resolves normally, and the second has 2  <attack>, <unit_attack> Attack 2 spaces in a line. The first attack resolves normally, and the second has 3  <attack>. <unit_attack> Attack 2 spaces in a line. The first attack resolves normally, and the second has 3  <attack>. <unit_attack> Attack 2 spaces in a line. The first attack resolves normally, and the second has 3  <attack>.

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• The first attack targets a unit directly in front of the Gold Dragons. The second attack targets the unit directly behind the primary target in a straight line. There is no choice here.
  • The target of the second attack does not carry out a retaliation attack against the Gold Dragons, as it is not adjacent to it.
  • Should the Gold Dragons attack two units in a line, both of the attacks are resolved first. The retaliation attack will only be carried out after the secondary attack of Gold Dragons has been resolved.
  • Should the Gold Dragons attack a unit, and the unit directly behind the primary target in a straight line happens to be a friendly unit, then the friendly unit will be the target of their secondary attack.
  • Should the Gold Dragons attack a Wall, no secondary attack will take place. Units behind the Wall are protected. Should they attack a unit directly in front of a Wall, the Wall will not take any damage.

docs.title: Licze
docs.text: GarstkaGrupaNeutralne Statistics Few Pack Neutral Town Necropolis Necropolis Neutral Tier <silver> <silver> <silver> Type <unit_ranged> <unit_ranged> <unit_ranged> <attack> 3 4 3 <defense> 1 1 0 <health_points> 5 5 6 <initiative> 6 7 7 Cost 8  <gold> 14  <gold> 12  <gold> Abilities - <unit_attack> Choose a unit adjacent to the target and attack it. For the purpose of this attack, your  <attack> is 2. <unit_attack> Choose a unit adjacent to the target and attack it. For the purpose of this attack, your  <attack> is 2.

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• Pack and Neutral - Liches can only do one extra attack, not more.
  • Pack and Neutral - The extra attacks of Liches also trigger when attacking an adjacent target.
  • Pack and Neutral - Should the Liches attack a unit and there is only a friendly unit adjacent to their target, then the friendly unit will be the target of their secondary attack (even if the unit is undead).
  • Pack and Neutral - Should the Liches attack an adjacent unit, and there is no other unit adjacent to the target, the Liches deal the damage of the second attack to themselves.
  • 1 Pack and Neutral - Should the Liches attack an adjacent unit, and there is another friendly unit adjacent to the target, they may target themselves for the second attack.
  • Pack and Neutral - Should the Liches attack an adjacent unit, and afterwards use the secondary attack on a unit that is adjacent to their original target, both of those attacks are resolved first. The retaliation attack will only be carried out after the secondary attack of Liches has been resolved.
  • 1 2 Pack and Neutral - Only on the large Battlefield: Should the Liches attack an adjacent unit, and both them, and their target have a common adjacent enemy to them, and this common adjacent unit is dealt damage from the secondary attack, both, the original target and the target of their secondary attack perform a retaliation attack against the Liches.

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• The effect can be used at the end of each of the player's turns, as long as the Nomads are in the player's unit deck (e.g. after being recruited by Diplomacy).

docs.title: Czarcie Lordy
docs.text: GarstkaGrupaNeutralne Statistics Few Pack Neutral Town Inferno Inferno Neutral Tier <silver> <silver> <silver> Type <unit_ground> <unit_ground> <unit_ground> <attack> 4 5 4 <defense> 1 1 1 <health_points> 6 6 5 <initiative> 6 7 7 Cost 8  <gold> 15  <gold> 15  <gold> Abilities - <unit_other> If one of your units has been removed from the board during this Combat, Summon or Reinforce Demons. -

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• Pack - Should the Pit Lords use their alternative action, they are not allowed to move, attack or defend.
  • Pack - Should the Pit Lords summon Few Demons, they have to be placed adjacent to the Pit Lords.
  • Pack - Should the Pit Lords reinforce Few Demons to a Pack of Demons, there is no recruitment cost to be paid.
  • Pack - The summoned Demons will activate during the Combat round when they were summoned, as long as their initiative is lower or equal to the initiative of the Pit Lords. If the initiative is higher, they are treated as if they were already activated during this Combat round.
  • Pack - The summoned or reinforced Demons stay in the player's army after the end of the Combat.
  • Pack - The Pit Lords may only summon or reinforce Demons once per Combat.

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• Pack - Only the Pack of Titans are a <unit_ranged>. Few Titans are a <unit_ground>.
  • Few and Pack - Friendly <ongoing> effects are also ignored.
  • Few and Pack - Titans ignore the <ongoing> effects of Buckler of the Gnoll King and Greater Gnoll's Flail, but the <instant> effects still apply.
  • Few and Pack - Should the first effect of the Orb of Inhibition be played, the Titans will also not be receiving any damage from spells, as the <ongoing> effect of the Orb of Inhibition works on spells in general and doesn't specifically target Titans.
  • 1 Few and Pack - Titans are immune to the effect of Disrupting Ray spell and the second effect of the Orb of Inhibition, because their ability is already in play at the time when the other effects are played.

docs.text:
• The ability is applied right after the Wraiths are activated.
  • If Wraiths were attacked by Wyverns, both the damage and the healing take place simultaneously. Nothing happens for faction (Few and Pack) Wraiths, and the Neutral variant removes up to 1 <damage>.

docs.title: Wiwerny
docs.text: GarstkaGrupaNeutralne Statistics Few Pack Neutral Town Fortress Fortress Neutral Tier <golden> <golden> <golden> Type <unit_flying> <unit_flying> <unit_flying> <attack> 5 6 4 <defense> 1 1 1 <health_points> 8 8 7 <initiative> 7 11 8 Cost 12  <gold> 18  <gold>1  <valuables> 17  <gold> Abilities <unit_attack> Place 1 faction cube on the target. At the beginning of its every activation, remove it to inflict 1  <damage>. <unit_attack> Place 2 faction cubes on the target. At the beginning of its every activation, remove 1 of them to inflict 1  <damage>. <unit_attack> After the attack, roll 1 Attack die. On a "0" result, deal 1  <damage> to the target unit.

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• Few and Pack - Enemy units, that were attacked by the Wyverns, receive damage on each activation, as long as there is at least one faction cube on them.
  • Few and Pack - If Trolls or Wraiths were attacked by the Wyverns, both the damage and the healing take place simultaneously. This means Trolls only remove up to 2 <damage>. Nothing happens for faction (Few and Pack) Wraiths, and their Neutral variant removes up to 1 <damage>.

docs.title: Zombie
docs.text: GarstkaGrupaNeutralneCrypt Statistics Few Pack Neutral Crypt Town Necropolis Necropolis Neutral - Tier <bronze> <bronze> <bronze> - Type <unit_ground> <unit_ground> <unit_ground> <unit_ground> <attack> 2 2 2 1 <defense> 1 1 0 0 <health_points> 3 3 4 2 <initiative> 3 4 3 3 Cost 3  <gold> 4  <gold> 5  <gold> - Abilities <unit_passive> If the attacker resolves a "+1" on Attack die, gain +1  <defense>. <unit_passive> If the attacker resolves a "0" or a +1" on Attack die, gain +1  <defense>. <unit_passive> If the attacker resolves a "0" or a "+1" on an Attack die, gain +1  <defense> <unit_passive> If the attacker resolves a "+1" on Attack die against this unit, gain +1  <defense>.

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text: • The ability is triggered when a regular attack is performed against the Zombies, as well as a retaliation attack.

docs.title: Wóz z Amunicją
docs.text:
Machina Wojenna

<permanent> Your <unit_ranged> units ignore combat penalties and gain "+2 <initiative>".

<pay> 5 <gold> at Blacksmith— OR — <pay> 8 <gold> at Trade Post

docs.title: Balista
docs.text:
Machina Wojenna

<permanent> At the beginning of each Combat round, deal 1 <damage> to the enemy unit with the lowest <initiative>.

<pay> 7 <gold> at Blacksmith— OR — <pay> 10 <gold> at Trade Post

docs.title: Cannon
docs.text:
Machina Wojenna

<permanent> At the beginning of each Combat round, you can spend 1 <expert> to deal 2 <damage> to 1 enemy unit.

<pay> 10 <gold> at Blacksmith— OR — <pay> 14 <gold> at Trade Post

docs.title: Catapult
docs.text:
Machina Wojenna

<permanent> At the beginning of each Combat round, you may pay 1 <building_materials> to choose 2 adjacent targets (any combination of units, Walls and the Gate) and deal 1 <damage> to each of them.

<pay> 8 <gold> at Blacksmith— OR — <pay> 12 <gold> at Trade Post

docs.title: Namiot Medyka
docs.text:
Machina Wojenna

<permanent> Once during each Combat round, remove 1 <damage> from your selected unit.

<pay> 3 <gold> at Blacksmith— OR — <pay> 6 <gold> at Trade Post

docs.title: Uwagi
docs.text:
• The effect may be used at any point during the Combat round (similar to an <instant> effect).
  • <damage> can only be removed after it was dealt. The First Aid Tent can not prevent defeat of a unit by reducing the incoming <damage>.
